attributes.action: Make weekly classes  in schools about the cruel affects of bullying compulsory
attributes.background:
I am hearing all too often of children taking their own lives due to the cruel bullies making their lives a mystery.
I was bullied myself in school over 20 years ago and am shocked more hasn't been done to try to prevent it.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to have a dog off lead on or near any public highway.
attributes.background: To protect the general public,drivers, other dog walkers and their dogs, all dogs, no matter how well behaved they may be, should be kept on a lead on or near any road.
attributes.additional_details: I have had three incidents myself recently involving loose dogs, which have been frightening for myself and my dog, but also which could have resulted in accident or injuries. In one incident a dog ran accross a busy road to get to mine, the owner said 'sorry, but he's friendly' - lucky he wasn't 'dead friendly'. I also know personally of several cases where dogs have been attacked by loose dogs, one of which was on their own driveway. Sadly the owners seem to think this is acceptable behaviour.

attributes.action: Ban child targeted advertising on unhealthy foods.
attributes.background: We have a huge obesity problem in the UK, yet we're targeting young children when selling unhealthy foods. Walking around the supermarket, I regularly see chocolate bars with Paw Patrol characters on the wrappers. This is shocking and needs to be stopped if we have any chance in tackling obesity.

attributes.action: Create a National Care Service
attributes.background:
This country needs a sister service to the NHS to focus on social care 

Care of vulnerable and elderly citizens 

Giving  social care a new and unique identity 

This new service would create new and specialised employment with career paths offering a rewarding career with decent pay
attributes.additional_details:
Social care has a poor image , often seen as low paid casual work 
But yet so vital in this age of an older generation 
A new identity a new structure 
With new career paths is needed

attributes.action: Government to fund a rail/bus discount card for those in education until age 18.
attributes.background: My friend's 16-year-old daughter is starting college this year and will need to travel by train and as there is no other alternative she has had to purchase an adult season ticket at huge expense.
attributes.additional_details:
As all children are expected to remain in education until the age of 18 it is unfair that their parents should have to pay full adult rail and bus fares for them.

Because our train and bus companies are all privately owned it is very difficult to ask them to change their policies, however, I do believe that the Government has a duty of care to all students and those undertaking low paid apprenticeships and I would like to ask Government to consider funding a student/young persons rail/bus discount card thereby helping to reduce travelling costs for parents.

attributes.action: Increase nhs staff awareness and training on the signs and symptoms of sepsis
attributes.background:
I have since heard of many other cases of children with sepsis being misdiagnosed having gastroenteritis, sometimes with long term effects. 
I want government to look at this issue and increase training awareness within the nhs to prevent more unnecessary child deaths or life changing effects.
attributes.additional_details:
Our son, had severe leg pain, a very high temperature, vomiting and neck stiffness. We called 111 who sent us an ambulance to a and e. When we arrived, were seen by the doctor, he took a brief look over our son and asked of his symptoms. We said the symptoms, then he concluded that it could be gastroenteritis. He said we could take him home if he could keep some food down, which he did. However I said I was very concerned as he could not sit up unaided at this point and I would like another opinion. The paedeatrician came and immediately suggested meningitis and sepsis. He took bloods immediately and put our son onto strong antibiotics (this saved his life). The bloods later came back as positive for meningococcal septaceamia. 
Without fast treatment for Sepsis, it can be fatal.

attributes.action: Ban plastic food containers at takeaways, food pots and trays
attributes.background: According to World Environmental Forum, we have become too depended on using plastics. More than 8 million tons of it ends up in the ocean every year. If we continue to pollute at this rate, there will be more plastic than fish in the ocean by 2050,”
attributes.additional_details:
Many countries around the world have banned the use of plastics. The U.K. must take action now!

Time is up for plastic use! We must protect our ocean and the next generation!
#Banplasticuse4good #Banplasticfoodpots #Banplastictakeawayboxes

Plastic food pots and trays are often unrecyclable, say councils - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-45058971

attributes.action: Make prescriptions free for all NHS staff
attributes.background: NHS staff are dedicated and commited to providing excellent healthcare for all people, however on the low wages they receive it seems only fair that they can take care of themselves too as a thank you.

attributes.action: Free Meals For All Kids in Primary Schools
attributes.background: Kids in Primary School should have free Schools meals. If the Prisoners have free meals why kids can’t have them too.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that should be addressed and actioned! 
Please sign my petition and let all kids have a free warm meal at school.

attributes.action: Keep Beechen Cliff as a state school as supported by parents and pupils
attributes.background:
The government are querying whether to close Beechen Cliff school in Bath due to a recent Ofsted report. This report was a shock to pupils, teachers and parents and in no way reflects the school.
Please sign this petition to stop the government withdrawing funding and closing the school

attributes.action: Use the money paid at hospital parkings for the NHS
attributes.background: Hospital parking is so expensive but the public would not begrudge paying it if they knew it would benefit the NHS

attributes.action: The government should require all rail companies to offer part season tickets.
attributes.background: Rail prices continually increase year on year out of line with wage increases. Those working part time are forced to make a choice between accepting sky high day fares or buying season tickets which do not offer good value for money. Women and carers are disproportionately affected.

attributes.action: Ban Smart Meters
attributes.background: There have been concerns about their effect on people’s health, along with the way that they could invade your privacy, and in the end they cost way more compared to an old type of meter.

attributes.action: Re-skill ALL shop floor workers who have been made redundant in 2018 onwards.
attributes.background: Around 30,000 jobs have been lost or at risk since Jan 1 2018. The British Retail Consortium are predicting that up to 1m jobs could be lost or at risk by 2020 in UK Retailing. Every shop worker should be given FREE training to start a new digital career in online retailing.

attributes.action: Give disabled young people more support to get on the housing ladder
attributes.background:
The young persons network in Herefordshire which supports young people to have a voice would like government to consider supporting young people to get onto the housing ladder.

This could be by making more homes accessible throughout the uk and offering funding packages specifically targeted YP
attributes.additional_details:
Our lead was been trying to live independently in a rented/brought house, but has struggled to find suitable housing in his local area.

The only option that he has found so far is buying a house and then having it adapted to suit his needs this could cost thousands.

Unfortunately he is not the only disabled young person in this position thousands of young disabled people across the uk want to live independently in there own home.

I want the govt to make funding ready for accessible homes

attributes.action: Adopt the STV voting system for a more representative government.
attributes.background: Our current FPTP voting system is extremely flawed. The system has been in use for so long that, just like the USA, we are stuck in a two-party system that we will never be able to break out of.
attributes.additional_details:
Let’s imagine a new country adopts the system and holds the first election. The results are-
Blue- 27% of votes 
Green-32% of votes
Red-21% of votes
Yellow-20% of votes.
Green party wins with only 32% of the country’s representatives but is elected PM (68% of the country is unrepresented).
This is the system we have in the UK. 
I don’t have enough characters left to explain the benefits of STV, but please use these videos to learn-
https://youtu.be/P38Y4VG1Ibo
https://youtu.be/l8XOZJkozfI

attributes.action: Provide statutory youth services and programs.
attributes.background: There is currently no statutory obligation on local authorities to provide Youth Service Programs in respective Councils across the UK. Recently, this has meant that councils, when faced with Government austerity cuts, have had to slash services to young people.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to these drastic measures, many Youth Centres in the hearts of our communities have already faced forced closure and hundreds of thousands of young people now face a much-reduced range of services, support, guidance and now lack access to opportunities to acquire critical life skills. 

According to research on the government website london.gov.uk, between 2011 and 2017, at least £39 million has been slashed from council youth service budgets across London. Across 25 councils with similar data, 81 youth centres and major council-supported projects have been cut, and about 800 youth service posts are gone. 

A statutory youth program would mean that the government would proper scrutinize where the money they invest in youth channelled programs would be spent well.

attributes.action: More help available for people who are suffering with mental health issues
attributes.background:
For many of us with mental health we have been failed by the services on offer within the NHS, We are often the ones left to one side. 

Offer more help to people who are admitted to A&E 

make more beds available in hospitals for people with mental health instead of sending us home to suffer.
attributes.additional_details:
We need early intervention available instead of being left until it’s simply to late. 

We need more beds available as many of us who attend A&E are often told that no beds are available or are not even offered one. 

Data compiled for the BBC by NHS Digital showed that between 2011-12 and 2015-16 the number of patients attending A&E units with psychiatric problems rose by nearly 50% to 165,000.

For the under 18s alone the numbers almost doubled to nearly 22,000.

attributes.action: Make it law that people have to vote, same as Australia
attributes.background: Make it law in the UK that people have to vote unless they have a legitimate reason not to. If they don't vote and don't have a legitimate reason then they should get fined.
attributes.additional_details: This needs to happen as the amount of people who do vote is appalling and numbers need to rise.

attributes.action: Refund the application fee for all unsuccessful British Citizenship applications
attributes.background: As a single mother, I used my life savings to apply for British application of myself and my daughter. I denied myself of basic necessities. The Home Office refused our application and took the whole money. I can’t stop thinking about it, this has led to depression and insomnia.
attributes.additional_details: A small admin fee would be reasonable for them to keep, but not the whole fee.

attributes.action: All staff in semh schools to be MHFA trained and a minimum of 7 inset days.
attributes.background: SEMH schools have students with varying needs that are written into an EHCP. It's only right that adequate mandatory training is available to all staff to help these students especially with the varying mental health needs. Funding and timing is a major factor, therefore more inset days are needed.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 of us are diagnosed with a MH illness at some point. 50% off these diagnosed needs are displayed at the age of 14. Semh schools deal with a lot of these students that display these needs alongside other needs. To help these students and to give them the best they deserve, it should be mandatory that EVERY member of staff is MHFA trained to recognise and deal with students that are in crisis. These members of staff are the early help for most of these students.

attributes.action: Make it law that cyclists must wear crash helmets
attributes.background: Make it law that all cyclists must wear protective headwear when out on the road.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015 - the last year for which statistics relating to accidents caused by cyclists are available - two pedestrians were killed and 96 seriously injured after being hit by a bicycle. But every year more than 100 cyclists are killed and more than 3,000 seriously injured on British roads – the majority by motorists.

attributes.action: One Island-One Member of Parliament -please keep our single MP for Isle of Wight
attributes.background:
10 September 2018
Commission's "final recommendations" to divide the Island to have 2 MPs. This is divisive. We need one MP to speak for all of us. One Island - one MP!

http://www.iwcp.co.uk/news/16832323.final-recommendations-for-isle-of-wight-parliamentary-constituencies-revealed/?ref=mr&lp=4
attributes.additional_details:
If you want one MP to support all of us as a united Island with one strong voice in Parliament, please support this petition. 

Thank you very much for your kind help.

attributes.action: Raise awareness towards borderline personality disorder (BPD).
attributes.background: Borderline Personality Disorder(BPD) affects people of all ages and it is brought on by previous traumatic experiences that cause/caused instability within someone's life. Those who suffer with BPD don't usually realise until late into adolescents, around 1 in 10 diagnosed end up committing suicide
attributes.additional_details: More awareness and understanding needs to be made available nationally to ensure that this number decreases. This is one of many mental health issues within the UK that is unheard of and for the most part, unknown. Often overlooked as Depression or Anxiety, BPD needs both awareness and more accurate diagnoses. We hope with this petition this can become a reality.

attributes.action: Introduce a Free Speech Act and end hate speech laws in the UK
attributes.background: We should have a law protecting the right to free speech like the USA. It should also repeal laws on hate speech and prevent people being arrested for jokes or offending someone.

attributes.action: Amend Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984 and Road Traffic Offenders Act 1988
attributes.background: I am a scooter rider who has ridden to work, from Kew to Central London, each day for many many years...with no fines! I have recently received 4 speeding tickets in one week for marginally exceeding the speed limit on the A40.
attributes.additional_details: I strongly believe the punishments in such cases (SP 30) do not fit the crime. My suggestion is that the law is changed so that penalty points are allocated depending on the amount of the excess speed reached...for instance 1 penalty point for 5 mile per hour excess..2 penalty points for 10 miles per hour and so on.

attributes.action: Put pressure on Bangladeshi government to improve road safety
attributes.background: In light of the recent events where two students were killed by a speeding driver,many students have been protesting for safer roads however they have been silenced by the police in the form of violence. Actions must be taken to ensure the safety of these people and to allow their voices to be heard

attributes.action: To legally stagger school holidays in each county in England
attributes.background: The current holiday system for schools forces holiday prices up very high in current school hols as all parents want holidays at similar times. Spreading this demand out by schools having different weeks off would lower prices for families but shouldn’t affect holiday companies profit. Help!!
attributes.additional_details: This is an ongoing issue known by everyone. I think rather than sitting back and letting families struggle for years to take their kids away something should be done. It’s not feasible to ask holiday companies to change prices without demand changing and the only way that can change is the government changing school holidays in England. Help families. Don’t just accept how it is!!

attributes.action: Impose a mandatory life sentence for acid attackers.
attributes.background: The act must be premeditated for the attcker to come prepared with acid, the effects are often lifelong and severe, the attacker knows this. Let's put the victim first in this sickening act.

attributes.action: change  personal injury law ,  anyone injured as a child can claim with no time
attributes.background: my sister in law was seriously burned when left unsupervised in a school playground when she was 7 yrs old. ( she is now 48 ) when her mother took her to a solicitor she was told unable to claim because she was a minor , the solicitor failed to inform her that she could claim when 18 until 21 .
attributes.additional_details:
when she tried to claim later in life she was told it was too late .
she was let down by the legal profession who failed to inform her of her rights. it is unacceptable that a child injured and unable to make 
informed decisions . and only have 3 years to report something.
when she has a lifetime of suffering .

attributes.action: Make it illegal for pedestrians to cross a road where a crossing is visible.
attributes.background: Too many RTA occur on the roads of England, with a majority of these being due to pedestrians crossing a road where a pedestrian crossing is accessible for them to use. Drivers are punished for stupidity of pedestrians! It’s illegal in the USA and I feel it should be here where a crossing is visible

attributes.action: Enforce a limit on the cost of vehicle insurance for young and new drivers
attributes.background: Insurance in the UK has been continuously on the rise for several years. The cost of insurance for young drivers aged 17 years old even on low powered, low insurance grouped vehicles can run them up to the likes of £1500-£3000 with no cap. The average cost a new young driver will pay is around £2000
attributes.additional_details:
This has been a well known fact for many years that insurance companies have been picking out every penny they can from young and new drivers with no justification. The cost of insurance supercedes the price of many young drivers value of the car sometimes up to 5 times.
This is hindering young drivers from wanting to drive and becoming independent as the cost is becoming extortionate and is only rising every year. There needs to be a cap on the amount insurance companies can charge.

attributes.action: Prevent requesting ID for energy drinks
attributes.background:
Due to recent media pressure, stores are now asking for ID for energy drinks. Energy drinks are a legal product, and most stores don't have the manpower or staffing availability to quickly serve their customers.
This behaviour should be stopped, driven as it is by a vocal segment of the population.

attributes.action: Increase organ donation by asking GP's to discuss the issue with their patients.
attributes.background:
I would like to raise awareness for organ donation to help those currently awaiting a transplant. At present, GP's do not ask patients whether they have ever considered donating their organs. 
I would like GP's to ask patients about organ donation as part of their routine medical appointments.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 7000 people are currently on the organ donation register awaiting a chance to improve their health and well-being. I am trying to increase awareness of the importance of organ donation across the UK and break down the stigma of having this crucial conversation. 
GP's play a vital role within our communities and have a close professional relationship with their patients, where discussions may be held freely. Please support my campaign to increase awareness and enrolment for organ donation.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for care services to be run as for profit companies
attributes.background: The way we treat our elder reflects the way that we as a society, are evolving. I have grown to experience the care sector in England in such a way that it is my firm belief that care services should only be run as community services funded by the people for the people.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm a care worker who has worked in different services and supported people with many conditions, lifestyle and backgrounds; who has observed the national health and care crisis and increase in mental health in the the general population, leading to breakdown support networks for many people.
Being a firm believer that all people on Earth are responsible for each other, I urge Parliament to change the law and make it illegal to make a profit out of the lives of vulnerable individuals.

attributes.action: Allow current part time students to apply for the new part time maintenance loan
attributes.background: the new provision to allow new part time students eligible for a maintenance portion of student finance, is unfair to legacy & distance learners, currently if you are a part time distance learning student you do not qualify for the maintenance loan unless you have a disability & are a new student
attributes.additional_details: the rules for part time maintenance loans need to be standardised across the board and student who are currently 1 or 2 years into their degree should be treated equally with those who are just applying to start their degree.  additionally only part time distance learners who are disabled are eligible for the maintenance loan, i propose that the rules are brought in line across the board and made available to all students without discrimination to existing students.

attributes.action: Ensure Small/Medium Businesses have access to funds promised on Private Jobs
attributes.background: After a string of unpaid invoices from clients and going down the route of small claims to no success and no one to be held accountable, I propose the government put in a system similar to : DPS for housing, in which Clients must commit allotted funds to a independent body to hold a TPS
attributes.additional_details:
Trade Protection Scheme- Having an Independent body holding funds until works are complete will ensure payment is guaranteed to the Trades, no risk of coming out empty handed after a long small claims route. If works are agreed, the agreed upon fee must be placed into holding before Works are to proceed to ensure Client has "put their money where their mouth is".

If terms are not agreed upon a mediation route is put in place to resolve, even if the court route is taken this will ensure funds are safe

attributes.action: Dissolve the Northern Ireland Assembly with immediate effect
attributes.background:
The Northern Ireland Assembly has failed all of the people of Northern Ireland.
As a direct consequence of MLA’s refusing to take their seats within the Government the country is failing.
The people have a right to have direction and leadership which the current Assembly is not providing.

attributes.action: Don't Raise Income Tax to pay for NHS - Find Alternative Source of Funds
attributes.background: Research has suggested that income tax may have to rise, by as much as £2,000 per household, to meet the future needs of the NHS. This would be unacceptable when the public is struggling to even scrape by.

attributes.action: Add "None of the above" to the election ballot paper.
attributes.background: With belief in MP's of all parties at an all time low, add "None of the above" to the ballot paper to remove all candidates in a constituency from standing in elections for 10 years. this may make candidates, MP's and parties more respectful and responsive to the electorate in their constituencies.
attributes.additional_details: If "None of the above" wins the ballot then all those candidate on the ballot paper would be barred from standing for office for 10 years

attributes.action: Make it illegal for prisoners to share a cell.
attributes.background:
Prison is a very stressful and violent environment. People are placed there to be so called "reabilitated'.
In order for a prisoner to progress, inmates should not have to endure the added suffering that is to share a cell.
How would you feel if you had to go to the toilet in front of a stranger.
attributes.additional_details:
I understand prison is place for people who broke the law but prison nowadays are full of people suffering from mental health issues who should not be there in the first place.
Prisons are the new "Asylums" and inmates suffering from mental health issues are particularly vulnerable in a cell sharing scenario.
Prison is about the loss of freedom, not suffering further torture while inside one.

attributes.action: Stop traumatising images on cigarette and tobacco packaging
attributes.background: The pictures are explicit pictures of children on the packaging of cigarettes and tobbaco. There is also one of an adult blowing smoke into a baby’s face. People have to look at these pictures in their everyday life and can be traumatising for many people.
attributes.additional_details: To stop the printing of child abuse and half dead children on cigarette packaging. It’s absolutely absurd that this would even be considered. Let alone commissioned within the UK. How this would benefit anyone I don’t know. It’s basically forcing people to look at these images. And should not be legal. It shows the mentality that plagues the English governing system today.

attributes.action: To make it illegal to walk any Dog in temperatures above 70 degrees Fahrenheit
attributes.background: Just being left outside without shade or exercise on a hot day can kill your dog! Avoid High Temperatures & Direct Sunlight anything over 70 degrees your dog is at risk from heat exhaustion. Dogs have fur and can’t sweat.  Dogs can only expel heat through their feet and by panting.

attributes.action: Give disabled victims of crime funding for support & services to obtain justice!
attributes.background: Disabled people such as those suffering with Autism find dealing with stress and anxiety very difficult, especially when they are victims of crime, it has a huge negative impact on their health, their life both at work and at home as well as their mental well being.
attributes.additional_details: Adequate funding and support should always be available via a bespoke fund for those disabled victims such as autistics or those with mental disabilities ensuring their needs are met to provide the services and support required so the most vulnerable in our society, who struggle to cope with life in general, let alone when they are the victims of crime are not left alone to deal with courts, ombudsman, regulators, MP's, media and police plus all the paperwork and documentation it entails.

attributes.action: Amend Highways act 1980 to allow electric powered motorcycles to use motorways
attributes.background: Recent developments have created high powered electric motorcycles, but as they do not have an engine with a capacity exceeding 50cc they are excluded from motorway travel. I propose that the Highways Act be amended to change the wording defining a motorcycle by power output not by engine capacity.
attributes.additional_details:
Highways act 1980 schedule 4 Classes of Traffic for Purposes of Special Roads
The Motorways traffic (England and wales) Regulations 1982

attributes.action: Make it illegal to burn state flags of all countries.
attributes.background: As we all know the UK is a very diverse and multicultural place especially London. For this reason, many people from different ethnics are united by flags that represent them. We must make it illegal to burn flags to decrease growing hate of different ethnics towards each other. eg Turks vs Kurds.

attributes.action: A Fair Parenting law so that both parents get equal child benefits.
attributes.background: Parents should receive benefits - Child Benefit, Disability Benefit or Carers allowance - for the period their child stays with them.
attributes.additional_details: Parents, particularly disabled parents, need help to feed and clothe their child for the time their children are with them. Parents are having to use food banks because the benefits that should follow the child stay with the resident parent no matter where the child is actually staying.

attributes.action: Make supermarkets STOP using plastic and start using more sustainable packaging
attributes.background: We have “12 years to limit climate change catastrophe” (IPPC) I cannot help but look around at these huge corporations that are constantly using up energy and plastic (creating what I can only imagine are vast amounts of waste) If we want to keep the world turning let’s DO something about it!!
attributes.additional_details: I know it’s not a quick fix issue but I think, even if just one corporation changed, a huge difference would be made. This discussion needs to continue and has to evolve into actions if the situation is going to get any better. People need to be educated into the importance of recycling and how it is to be carried out because, I know it’s hard to believe, but some people have no idea what can and can’t be recycled! Please help change occur and sign this petition to start conversations and action

attributes.action: Make detentions in schools illegal if the parent's do not give consent.
attributes.background: I believe after-school detentions of students without parental consent should be banned because it is unfair to the parents if they have something planned and occasionally schools give detentions in poor judgement so I think its important to show the parent's opinion on the matter.

attributes.action: Reclassify the antihistamine fexofenadine hydrochloride from POM to P.
attributes.background: There should be greater availability of more powerful antihistamines which can help to reverse the allergic reaction process in the very early stages. Fexofenadine hydrochloride is available at pharmacies in many European countries, UAE, Japan and Australia.
attributes.additional_details:
According to Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency (May, 2016) as part of a freedom of information request, the drug remains as classified as a prescription only medicine (POM) in the UK.
Many deaths could be prevented as a result of reclassification to P, where the drug can be made more accessible by being issued under the supervision of a pharmacist.
